channel.title: Other then "hello world" What's the best way to start java
channel.description: Other then the program "hello world", and learning from rs-ps What is the best way to learn the language "java" I learn through interaction, so don't send me to some documentary. And the reason I don't use google is because I believe they're all documentaries...

item.title: Other then "hello world" What's the best way to start java
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

karel https://www.google.co.uk/search?sugexp=chrome,mod=11&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8&q=karel+the+robot

Read full topic

item.title: Other then "hello world" What's the best way to start java
item.dc:creator: @Natey Natey
item.description:
@Natey wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:4, topic:443700”]http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/reallybigindex.html[/quote]This, read over them a couple times. Apply some of the info there to server, writing your own programs, etc,. You’ll get it.

Read full topic
item.source: Other then "hello world" What's the best way to start java

item.title: Other then "hello world" What's the best way to start java
item.dc:creator: @Xellium Xellium
item.description:
@Xellium wrote:

Most of the time when people make these threads asking for help, they just want some poor bastard to sit next to them and spoonfeed. I’m not saying it’s you, I’m just creating a generalization to what I’ve seen before.

Read full topic
item.source: Other then "hello world" What's the best way to start java

item.title: Other then "hello world" What's the best way to start java
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

I’m still learning Java yet, I’ve made a few silly programmes such as one that calculates times tables using loops and user input. It’s pretty fun to do, you should give it a shot.

Read full topic

@sw3ldn wrote:

BOOKS! BOOKS! BOOKS! BOOKS! i recommend the series “java for dummies” it breaks everything down and helps you understand everything.

item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

I create games that I play in real life. First one I remember is blackjack. It was a fun learning experience.

Read full topic
item.source: Other then "hello world" What's the best way to start java

item.title: Other then "hello world" What's the best way to start java
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Receptor, post:1, topic:444005”][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=546377.msg4006201#msg4006201 date=1338663266]
My first applications were simple calculators which allowed me to explore all the java operators.
[/quote]

Damn! There must have been tons of these. In fact no one knows exactly how many operators there are in java. New ones are occasionally discovered by dedicated enthusiasts. Definitely a promising future research field.

Have you read the in-depth essay on the addition operator by Richard Hardwood?[/quote]
they’re usually different from language to language too

Read full topic
item.source: Other then "hello world" What's the best way to start java

item.title: Other then "hello world" What's the best way to start java

something that always whet my appetite for programming was writing silly little text RPGs

Congratulations on the Java Guru- you deserve it.

one problem: he doesn’t use java

[/quote][/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Other then "hello world" What's the best way to start java
item.dc:creator: @Sylva Sylva
item.description:
@Sylva wrote:

A great place to start if you’re not into textbooks is http://www.codecademy.com/
It’s specifically JavaScript, but it’s interactive and will give you a good feel for programming in general. There are tons of tutorials and labs to do there.

Read full topic

item.title: Other then "hello world" What's the best way to start java
item.dc:creator: @ravekitty ravekitty
item.description:
@ravekitty wrote:

[quote=“Native^, post:2, topic:443700”]Just make files for each feature of the language and test them. If you feel convenient enough, start making some basic i/o programs, or servers/clients.

Anyway, that’s how I learn new languages.[/quote]
Nevermind I have an idea c;

Read full topic
item.source: Other then "hello world" What's the best way to start java

Anyway, that’s how I learn new languages.
